(27022, 30381).description: Whirlpool-like structures in the ocean that play a crucial role in ocean circulation and the distribution of heat and nutrients

(27022, 30381).name: subducting
(27022, 30381).label: ocean circulation
(27022, 30381).description: The process by which a layer of water sinks beneath another layer, often associated with ocean fronts and eddies

(27022, 30381).name: upwelling
(27022, 30381).label: ocean circulation
(27022, 30381).description: The process by which deep water rises to the surface, often associated with ocean fronts and eddies

(29826, 32090).name: fronts
(29826, 32090).label: ocean circulation
(29826, 32090).description: The large-scale movement of water masses in Earth’s oceans, driven by wind, density differences, and the Coriolis effect, which regulates Earth’s climate

(29826, 32090).name: ecosystems
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: Complex communities of living organisms and their interactions with the environment

(29826, 32090).name: satellites
(29826, 32090).label: instrument
(29826, 32090).description: Devices orbiting the Earth used for remote sensing, communication, and navigation

(29826, 32090).name: ACC
(29826, 32090).label: ocean circulation
(29826, 32090).description: The Antarctic Circumpolar Current, a major ocean current surrounding Antarctica and influencing global climate patterns

(29826, 32090).name: climate change
(29826, 32090).label: weather event
(29826, 32090).description: Long-term changes in the Earth's climate system, including rising temperatures and altered weather patterns

(29826, 32090).name: Southern Ocean
(29826, 32090).label: location
(29826, 32090).description: The ocean surrounding Antarctica, playing a key role in global ocean circulation and climate regulation

(29826, 32090).name: carbon sink
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: A natural or artificial system that absorbs and stores carbon dioxide from the atmosphere

(29826, 32090).name: climate models
(29826, 32090).label: model
(29826, 32090).description: Sophisticated computer simulations that integrate physical, chemical, biological, and dynamical processes to represent and predict Earth's climate system

(29826, 32090).name: Argo floats
(29826, 32090).label: instrument
(29826, 32090).description: Autonomous instruments used to measure ocean properties such as temperature and salinity

(29826, 32090).name: biogeochemical sensors
(29826, 32090).label: instrument
(29826, 32090).description: Devices used to measure chemical and biological properties of the ocean, such as dissolved oxygen, CO2, and nutrients

(29826, 32090).name: ocean gliders
(29826, 32090).label: instrument
(29826, 32090).description: Autonomous underwater vehicles used for oceanographic research and monitoring

(29826, 32090).name: marine animals
(29826, 32090).label: platform
(29826, 32090).description: Organisms used as platforms for carrying oceanographic instruments to collect data

(29826, 32090).name: oceanographic instruments
(29826, 32090).label: instrument
(29826, 32090).description: Devices used to measure and study the properties of the ocean

(29826, 32090).name: biogeochemical data
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: Measurements of the chemical and biological properties of the ocean, such as dissolved oxygen, CO2, and nutrients

(29826, 32090).name: dissolved oxygen
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: The amount of oxygen dissolved in seawater, an important indicator of ocean health

(29826, 32090).name: CO2
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: Carbon dioxide, a greenhouse gas that plays a crucial role in the Earth's climate system

(29826, 32090).name: nutrients
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: Substances necessary for the growth and survival of marine organisms

(29826, 32090).name: Marine Mammals Exploring the Oceans Pole to Pole
(29826, 32090).label: project
(29826, 32090).description: A research project that equips marine mammals with oceanographic instruments to study the ocean and its properties

(29826, 32090).name: temperature
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: A measure of the thermal energy of the ocean, an important factor in ocean circulation and climate regulation

(29826, 32090).name: salinity
(29826, 32090).label: variable
(29826, 32090).description: The concentration of dissolved salts in seawater, an important property influencing ocean circulation
